column4: hi all. so i just upgraded to oneiric. in the process of going to precise... general question: so i chose lightdm over gdm. in gdm, to run an application it was alt+f2, and now it's coming up as a "search" or whatever... i don't need to search. i know what i want to run. what's the keyboard shortcut for that in lightdm?
I think you have lightdm/gmd confused with gnome/unity
lightdm and gdm are what you see when you are typing in your password to log in
what you are describing is the unity search bar (after being logged in)
if you just need it for launching applications, then just use it like you did the old F2. If you hint enter it will automatically launch the top-left-most application being displayed
well, i did alt+f2, type in 'totem' and hit enter. nothing happens. but if i type 'totem' in a terminal window, it opens up. sooo i dont know why it's not working in this unity search thing.
when you type in "totem" into the search, do you see the totem player's icon in the box below the search line?
try the totem-video-indexer one, it may just have a weird name...
can you click the second icon at the very bottom? (ruler|pen|pencil icon)
heh, okay. it's showing up as "movie player"
so if i alt+f2 and type  'movie player' , it opens up.
well, it seems unintuitive. i want to run 'totem' , not 'movie player' heh...
I guess the totem devs decided "totem" was descriptive enough :P
